formattedAddress: 441 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 441 E 12th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

editorialSummary.text: Snug Scandinavian eatery fixing up open-faced toasts, bowls & sandwiches, plus breakfast & beer.

originalText.text: Visited for lunch, the herring open face sandwiches were great! Really well-made and flavorful. Their curry herring was my favorite! It’s a very small restaurant and it looks like they get super crowded during peak times. Highly suggest a reservation if you’re visiting on the weekends.

text.text: Visited for lunch, the herring open face sandwiches were great! Really well-made and flavorful. Their curry herring was my favorite! It’s a very small restaurant and it looks like they get super crowded during peak times. Highly suggest a reservation if you’re visiting on the weekends.

originalText.text:
Very rarely am I blown away by “hyped up places” these days but this is one of the few. Came here with a friend with no reservation on the weekend and was seated outside within 10 mins! The staff was beyond kind and helpful. We were super excited to try the food here so we ordered a bunch including matchas, the cardamom bun, the sweet potato & leek soup, the veggie sandwich with smoked salmon, and the crispy potato smørrebrød. The matchas were pretty standard and the cardamom bun was a little
bigger than other places. The soup was so amazing. It came with bread on the side, but all the flavors together with the spices in the soup and its almost paste-like texture made it so good on a cold day. The veggie sandwich was massive, almost inedible because everything kept pouring out of it. The picked vegetables and the marinated greens paired so well with the smoked salmon. I couldn’t get enough. The portion was also so so massive for the price. The crispy potato smørrebrød was acidic and savory in the best ways. Though it was smaller in portion to other dishes, it was dense and filling. Great texture and flavors on all the dishes. Cute lil shop where you can sit indoor or outdoor. And amazing bakery next door for just fika. Would definitely come here again and would highly recommend!!

text.text:

originalText.text:
We made a reservation and visited Smor in the East Village for a Sunday brunch. Our absolute favorite was the avocado toast with sunny-side eggs, easily one of the best I’ve had in NYC. The bacon and egg sandwich came in as a close second, delicious and fresh. The salmon toast with dill was good, though I think it could be improved with a different choice of bread.

Their pancakes resembled crepes but were quite tasty. An interesting quirk is that you can’t order lattes there; you have to head to their neighboring bake shop for coffee.

Despite that, we’ll definitely be returning for another visit.

text.text:

Their pancakes resembled crepes but were quite tasty. An interesting quirk is that you can’t order lattes there; you have to head to their neighboring bake shop for coffee.

Despite that, we’ll definitely be returning for another visit.

originalText.text: Excellent soups, salads and sandwiches — we love this place! We ordered the crepe pancakes to share, and the strawberry compote with whip cream was amazing. Looking forward to coming back!

text.text: Excellent soups, salads and sandwiches — we love this place! We ordered the crepe pancakes to share, and the strawberry compote with whip cream was amazing. Looking forward to coming back!

originalText.text:
Overall rating: 4.8

Super cute Scandanavian spot in the EV. I’ve never had Scandanavian food before so I was very excited to give it a try! I went with 2 friends & this is what we shared:

- Sampler: 5/5 ($18)
>> a great way to try different items!
- Cashew & Pea Salad: 5/5 ($13)
>> sooo good. I didn’t really taste that much cashew but it was very tasty
- Swedish Meatballs: 4/5 ($23)
>> it was good. Nothing special. Was missing something or flavor.
- Danish hot dog: 5/5 ($7)
>> very unique and delicious
- side of Potato Salad: 3/5 ($6.5)
>> meh, didn’t hate it. Felt average.
- Hangover Sandwich: 4/5 ($18.5)
>> good but very big. I don’t think it was needed to order. We were stuffed with what we already had
- Danish Pancakes: 5/5 ($12)
>> very much worth it!

Pictures do not do the place justice due to the red lighting. I do think it’s a very tight place, but everything else was great. The service was very nice & was able to memorize everything we ordered! Highly recommend.
